column4: Hello. I have Debian Etch system with standard out-of-box PAM auth and a Dovecot imapd on it. I need PAM to successfully authentify a user "user" if he logs in as "user" or as "user@somedomain" or as "user@whateverelse", with same password, UID and home directory. How can I?
(done my googling homework already)
is there a reason you are asking debian questions in #ubuntu ?
yes, unfortunatly. nobody answers on debian and general linux channels
ok.    well good luck with it here.   that's a little deeper than this channel normally gets.
after several hours googling, hope still dies last (:
understood.     wish i could help with that. but i have never setup a mail server and am all but network illiterate anyway.
i came to conclusion tha it can't be done with dovecot's resources, so it became a general PAM question
it is possible, but the other mail servers will think u're a spammer, the use to have dynamic IP's in blacklists
use gmail of web hosting server as "smarthost" to relay your mails
would i need an account on gmail for that ?
sure you do
btw, they provably have a limit on how many mails you can send in a hour. so if you plan to do a mailing list broadcast, better use a web hosting. If you try to spam, they will ban you soon
yeah spam is not the plan
smarthost and "relay" are your keywords then.
ok.  thanks.   /me goes to read up
